title: Test
yAxis: GDP growth compared to previous year
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, with a total of 11 data points.
Overall GDP growth compared to previous year has decreased over the Year

GDP growth compared to previous year is slightly decreasing from 2014 to 2015, gradually constant from 2015 to 2017, rapidly decreasing from 2017 to 2019, rapidly increasing from 2019 to 2020, and lastly roughly constant from 2020 to 2024.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2018 and 2019.
Max GDP growth compared to previous year about 2.47 was recorded at Year 2017
Min GDP growth compared to previous year about 0.54 was recorded at Year 2019
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2021 to 2024.
But, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2014 to 2017.
Similarly, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2019 to 2021.
Also, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2017 to 2019.
